block.p: The GCI Group is acquiring the business of Russell-Welsh Inc. in San Mateo, Calif., a communications agency specializing in public relations and investor relations for biotechnology, life science and medical device companies like Neurobiological Technologies and Organogenesis. Terms were not disclosed.

The GCI Group is acquiring the business of Russell-Welsh Inc. in San Mateo, Calif., a communications agency specializing in public relations and investor relations for biotechnology, life science and medical device companies like Neurobiological Technologies and Organogenesis. Terms were not disclosed.

Russell-Welch accounts and some employees will be absorbed into the GCI Healthcare practice at the GCI office in San Francisco. Katharine Russell, 52, president at Russell-Welch, will serve as a senior counselor to GCI; she and the other Russell-Welch employees plan to start a consumer-oriented dot-com, to be based in what has been the agency's San Mateo office. GCI is part of Grey Advertising in New York, which is being reorganized as the Grey Global Group.
